subject: Implementing a TestSuite
msgSnippet: Hi all, I have been happily using junit for a while now but I ve been implementing suite() differently than I ve seen others.  I ve seen the examples where a
messageBody:
Hi all,

I have been happily using junit for a while now but I've been
implementing suite() differently than I've seen others. I've seen
the examples where a suite() method is implemented in a class derived
from Object by instantiating a concrete TestSuite but I am inclined
to implement my test suites like so:

public class SBTFastTestSuite extends TestSuite {
public SBTFastTestSuite() {
addTest( new FrameworkFastTestSuite() );
addTestSuite( ClusterableHttpServletRequestTest.class );
addTestSuite( ClusterableHttpSessionTest.class );
}
public static Test suite() {
return new SBTFastTestSuite();
}
}

My reasoning is that I like to show that my test suite class IS-A
test suite.
I am wondering whether my inclination is due to my not understanding
some aspect of junit?
Is there any reason why I shouldn't do it this way?

Andrew Small
